column4: can anyone tell me how to install an i386 program on an amd64 build of ubuntu?
will that change my system to 32bit, or will it just allow me to run 32bit programs?
sometimes you can edit a few lines of source code and compile for 64bit
may I ask what program you want to run?
i use 32bit libs and runs fine.  in fact you can run 32bit and 64 bit firefox together to test the speed
i am reading that there is more than one way of getting 32bit libs..
probably easiest to use synaptic.. but silly me forgot what the package names are
alright i'll have a look.  thank you
i'm totally at a loss as to which package it might be.. is it in libraries (old)?
let me see what I can find... give me a few
sudo apt-get install ia32-libs  also have a look at http://packages.ubuntu.com/gutsy/libs/ia32-libs
that should get you rolling.. the link was just for reference
you can also search synaptic with "ia32" for all available programs and utilities or shell command sudo apt-cache search ia32
